name: Location & Notification Filter
Flow Docuentation
info:
## **MQTT Input Topics from Python AI code:**
   - The Python AI code "publishes" these topics.
   - Other systems cam subscribe to these topics.
1. **AI/Detection**:  Buffer with topic containing camera info of most recent AI detection image.
2. **ImageBuffer**: MQTT buffer of current image from UI selected camera, used by "Dashboard" web page.  Depending on **Alarm/MODE** and **Alarm/UImode** either live images or only the last detection will be sent.
3. **AmAlive**: "watchdog" timer, can trigger restart of Python code, or system if necessary.
4. **AI/Status**: AI Startup, Shutdown, and "Will" status messages.

## **MQTT Outputs to control Python AI code:**
   - These modes affect the flow operation as well as what the PythonAI code does
   - The Python AI code "subscribes" to these topics from broker set by -mqtt command line arguement, defaults to localhost.
1. **Alarm/MODE**: payload Idle, Audio, or Notify: sets mode, affects flow and Python AI code.  
2. **Alarm/UImode**: payload 0, 1, 2: 0-Disable, 1-Live, 2-Detections sending of ImageBuffer to Dashboard 
3. **Alarm/ViewCamera**: payload N: Select camera N to be viewed on "Dashboard" UI webpage.
   - The Python code subscribes to broker set by -camMQTT command line arguement, defaults to localhost.
4. **MQTTcam/N**: payload jpeg image: fed to AI as input from camera N
 
## **Espeak**: MQTT Input Iopic lets node-red host be remote speaker for others if so equipped.
   - Payload is text to speak: "' This is only a test. '" note quotes within quotes

# **Dashboard UI** Controls
1. **AI Mode**: payload: Idle Audio Notify, sets **Alarm/MODE** for the Python AI code.
2. **Set UI View**: payload 0, 1, 2: sets **Alarm/UImode** viewing mode.
   - 0 **Disable**: Don't show images on Dasboard webpage.
   - 1 **Live**: display real-time images from selected camera.
   - 2 **Detections**: Only show frames with AI detections.
   - 3 **All Detections**: Display the most recent detection from any camera, select camera is ignored.
3. **Select Camera**: sets **AlarmViewCamera** to choose the camera to display on the Dashboard webpage.

# **System Controls**
  - These generally are only useful if the node-red controller is running on the Python AI host.
  - Ideal for controlling a "headless" host remotely with a web browser.
1. **StartAI** 
      - Wire to either autostart TPU or NCS
2. **Reboot**
3. **Shutdown**

# **General Setup**:
  - Edit **Email Notification** for the username@gmail.com and password for Emailed notifications.
    - gmail account must have "less secure access" enabled in account settings for this node to work.
  - Edit Espeak "Cam Num" strings to something more useful, pay attension to the single quotes within the double quotes!

# **Setup**: Only if viewer/controller is running on the Python AI Linux host.
1. Wire **Daily Cleanup** to **disk cleanup**, edit exec command and script as necessary.
2. Wire **Launch AI** and **watchdog** to **Autostart**, edit exec command and script as necessary.
